metadata.title: CVE-2022-0847 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way the "flags" member of the new pipe bufferstructure was lacking proper initialization in copy_page_to_iter_pipe andpush_pipe functions in the Linux kernel and could thus contain stalevalues. An unprivileged local user could use this flaw to write to pages inthe page cache backed by read only files and as such escalate theirprivileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0847` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required
